# Introduction to Planetary Science ğŸª

## What you'll learn:
- **Planets and Moons** - The worlds of our solar system
- **Small Bodies** - Asteroids, comets, meteoroids
- **Solar System Formation** - How it all began
- **Kepler's Laws** - Orbital mechanics

## The Solar System

| Object | Type | Notable Feature |
|--------|------|----------------|
| Sun | Star | 99.8% of system mass |
| Mercury | Terrestrial | Extreme temps |
| Venus | Terrestrial | Hottest planet |
| Earth | Terrestrial | Life! |
| Mars | Terrestrial | Red planet |
| Jupiter | Gas giant | Great Red Spot |
| Saturn | Gas giant | Rings |
| Uranus | Ice giant | Sideways rotation |
| Neptune | Ice giant | Strongest winds |

slides.title: Terrestrial Planets
slides.content:

Rocky planets with solid surfaces.

## Comparison

| Planet | Diameter | Distance (AU) |
|--------|----------|---------------|
| Mercury | 4,879 km | 0.39 |
| Venus | 12,104 km | 0.72 |
| Earth | 12,742 km | 1.00 |
| Mars | 6,779 km | 1.52 |

## Key Features

- **Mercury**: Smallest, no atmosphere
- **Venus**: Dense CO2, 465Â°C surface
- **Earth**: Liquid water, magnetic field
- **Mars**: Olympus Mons, past water

slides.content:
# Gas and Ice Giants ğŸª

## Gas Giants

### Jupiter
- Largest planet
- Great Red Spot storm
- 95+ moons

### Saturn
- Famous rings
- Less dense than water
- 146+ moons

## Ice Giants

### Uranus
- Tilted 98Â°
- Blue-green color
- 27 moons

### Neptune
- Strongest winds (2,100 km/h)
- Deep blue
- 16 moons

slides.content:
# Moons ğŸŒ™

## Notable Moons

| Moon | Planet | Feature |
|------|--------|---------|
| Luna | Earth | Tidally locked |
| Ganymede | Jupiter | Largest moon |
| Europa | Jupiter | Subsurface ocean |
| Io | Jupiter | Most volcanic |
| Titan | Saturn | Has atmosphere |
| Enceladus | Saturn | Ice geysers |
| Triton | Neptune | Retrograde orbit |

slides.title: Small Bodies
slides.content:
# Small Bodies ğŸŒ 

## Asteroids
Rocky remnants in asteroid belt (Mars-Jupiter).

## Comets
Icy bodies with tails pointing away from Sun.

| Source | Location |
|--------|----------|
| Kuiper Belt | 30-50 AU |
| Oort Cloud | 50,000 AU |

## Meteoroid Terms
| Term | Definition |
|------|------------|
| Meteoroid | Rock in space |
| Meteor | Burning in atmosphere |
| Meteorite | Hits ground |

slides.title: Solar System Formation
slides.content:
# Solar System Formation â­

## Nebular Hypothesis

1. Giant molecular cloud
2. Gravitational collapse
3. Rotating disk forms
4. Sun ignites at center
5. Planets form from disk

## Frost Line

| Inside | Outside |
|--------|--------|
| Rock only | Rock + ice |
| Terrestrial | Gas/Ice giants |

**Age: 4.6 billion years**

slides.title: Kepler's Laws
slides.content:
# Kepler's Laws ğŸ“

## First Law
Planets orbit in **ellipses** with Sun at one focus.

## Second Law
Equal areas swept in equal times (faster when closer).

## Third Law
```
PÂ² = aÂ³
P = period (years)
a = semi-major axis (AU)
```

| Planet | a (AU) | P (years) |
|--------|--------|----------|
| Earth | 1.00 | 1.00 |
| Mars | 1.52 | 1.88 |
| Jupiter | 5.20 | 11.86 |
